text:
What's this "having a picnic" shit
in my car?

Please, man, I'm not getting sex
at home. Don't deny me this.

You sleep with
a beautiful woman nightly.

I'm married. "Married" means you
sleep together, but you can't get none.

Watch it with all that shit,
all right?

- Where are your cup holders?
- I don't have one.

What do you mean? $80,000
for this car and there's no cup holder?

It's $105,000, and it's one of
the fastest production cars on Earth.
0 to 60 in 4 seconds.

- It's a limited edition.
- You damn right it's limited.
No cup holder, no back seat.

It's a shiny dick
with two chairs in it.

I guess we the balls,
just dragging the fuck along.
Damn.
Sorry.
Get it.

I can't get down there.
You got an engineering flaw.

My shit ain't going down
up in there.

Go.
Titty-titty, strutty-strutty.
Make them want it.
I ain't cleaning up after you.

My hand can't get down there.
When it does, it gets stuck.

Now, what do you come up with?
You got this shit.
Get that fry.
This ain't Denny's.

I wouldn't buy from Denny's.
I don't like how we been treated.

They bit.
Let's gank these fools.

You ain't interested in the fry.
You all up in that.

- Get out.
- Shit.

- What the fuck?
- We've had a big week.
So get the fuck out of the car.

Damn.
What you weigh, 350?

I bet you're a Popeye chicken-eating
motherfucker, ain't you?

Why I always get
the big, thick motherfuckers?
Get out.
All right. All right.
Hold on.

Funny. Let me tell you
how bad a day you're having.
You're jacking a couple of cops.

Oh, yeah?
Well, I'm a stand-up comedian...

...and I suck!
So I need your car.
I ain't Wesley Snipes.

I just hang out with stupid-ass friends
who drive stupid-ass cars...
...that attract fucking attention.

I need to jump over this car
and smack you in the head.

- You're arguing over a fry.
- It's not about that.

It's about your lack of respect
for people's property.

- Hey, hey.
- Shut up!

This is stupid.
Hold the fuck on.

If you want some bad enough,
come get some.
You like that shit?
Wesley Snipes, Passenger 57.
Now get me a fucking Handi Wipe.

Now let's hear one
of those jokes, bitch.

What do you think?
Looks like the real thing.

- Remember your assignment?
- Yeah, I'm a decoy.
Yes, you are.
What are you doing?

Hello, police? I just saw
something terrible: a policeman shot...

...at South Miami and 1st Street.
Help, please.
All units. Officer down.
Respond code 3.
All units respond and identify.

This is Air 2.
We got a full perimeter.

Officer down.
We need additional ground units.

Air 3, roger.
Suspect or suspects unknown.
Gentlemen, it's clear.
We're inside.

- We're in.
- You got 20 minutes.
Goddamn tacos will kill me.

Okay, we got 12 minutes.
Come on, let's go.
Clear. We're in.

Move your ass.
We got 6 minutes.
Ready.

Ready to fire.
Go.
Fire.
Go.
Move!
Damn.
Did you have sweet dreams?
You're so nasty.

You always saying
you want quality time.

Well, right now I got the time
and you damn sure got the quality.
Come on now.
You know what it is?

I can't remember the last time
we fell asleep together.
Baby...

Baby, it's my job.
It's what it requires.

I'm a better cop when
I get some in the morning.
I feel lighter on my feet.

Keep it in your pants.
I hear 3 little Burnetts coming.
That's cold.

You leave me here
like a humping dog.
Hi, baby boy.

- Daddy. Daddy.
- What's up?

At school, people say I look weird.
They say my ears look funny.

Your daddy has that same problem.
But you know what?

They for you to listen
to people's problems.

You're an angel. These are
your wings. Flap, flap. That's all.

James, stop.
Would you take them off?

Don't make me come to your school.
I'll arrest the principal.
Talking about my boy's ears.

- Uncle Mike's in the house.
- What's up, Uncle Mike?
Partner, partner.

- Check it out.
- What'd you take my food for?

Don't. I don't know where
your lips were last night.

- Did you have a date last night?
- Did I.

Let me tell you.
This girl was--

Don't tell my son
your sleazy sex stories.

I only tell your husband
my sleazy sex stories.

I don't want him knowing either.
It gives him ideas.

Why put me in this?
I'm with my babies.
Okay? Thank you.
Eat. Go on.
No problem.
You're on the mike with Mike.

Captain, I think you mean to say,
"Get our asses down there, please."
Maybe not.
Hey, baby.
Where's Howard?

Down there. He's looking for you.
He's been in better moods.
Damn.
Get it done, goddamn it.
Welcome to our nightmare.
See this?
What's wrong with this picture?
Remember this room?
These flats look familiar?

There were these silver packets
that looked like bricks.

Little red tags on them,
about so high?

All that heroin, gone.
- This was our career bust.
One hundred million dollars.

- Gone.
- This is bad.

No, let me call it what it is:
this is fucked up.
You got that right.
Hello, Alison.

You guys know Captain Sinclair,
Internal Affairs' top watchdog.

I'd take that as a compliment,
but I know you.

If you two want to get personal,
I could step out--

It's nothing personal.
I'm just doing my job.

I love knowing that one leak can turn
this nightmare into a media frenzy.

That won't happen.
We'll get the dope back before that.

Good. Start by looking here because
this had to have been an inside job.
I'll find out about it.
Sanchez, Ruiz, you're late.

So they put this in for
toxic drug fumes?

Yeah, this was a brilliant design.
This was really intelligent. I like this.

I didn't ask how he feels.
What did he see?
What does he know?
Where were y'all last night?

Have your cousins bring it back
and we can all get some sleep.

We were going to,
but we came up with a problem.
Your mama snorted up all the dope.
All right, you two, get over there.

O'Fee is okay
but has nothing to tell us.

So they kill a decoy,
it empties the station. Very smart.

But they don't kill a real cop,
or the whole force would be on them.

This was your case.
You're back on it.

Sanchez, Ruiz, back them up
with whatever they need.
Shut your mouths.

But wait a second. It was Carrera's
drugs in the first place, right?

It couldn't have been him, he was
killed in prison. What about his crew?

Those idiots don't have
the precision to do this.

But just in case I'm wrong,
check them out.

Yeah, they would
have been up in here with Uzis.
It takes brains do this.

- Big cojones too.
- What are you talking about?

It would take a month to explain
what cojones are.

You in Miami.
You don't know cojones?

We got nothing. What's the matter
with you? We've got nothing.

The guy who pulled this off
knew what he was doing.
He left us a big "Fuck you."
Ruiz, Sanchez...

...find out who installed
the ventilating system. Do that now.

- That's cold.
- So's your mama's bed.

This could definitely be an inside job.
Don't rule it out.

The way I see it, we got 72 hours
before the FBI and DEA...
...walk in and shut us down.
We'll be the bad guys.

The politics demand that somebody
take the rap for this, and it'll be us.

Just do what you do.
Only faster.
Jojo, you still a chemist, right?
Cutting drugs and shit like that?

I don't know about that.
I'm out of the drug business.
You know something.
I just said "no" to drugs.

He said "no" to drugs.
What you into, Jo?

- Rubber. Check it out.
- You're selling tires, huh?

You know nothing?
Jojo don't know nothing.
I know tires.

- You telling me the truth, right?
- Would I lie to you?
Hey. You driving.
This is a waste of time.

I keep telling you, in Maxie's line
of work, she definitely gets the 411.

Maxie. How'd I know
I was gonna find you up in here?

We got to talk.
Is there some place we can go?
Yeah, the equipment room.

- Behave yourself.
- I'm cool.

- Listen, I need some help. Again.
- So, what else is new?

Some major ill shit
happened down at the P.D.

There's lots of heroin
and cash involved.

There'll be some jolly young men
who want to party.
What do you need?

Lots of people
will talk to you, not me.
You mean customers?

I'm not asking you to get into any wild
shit. Just call if you hear something.
I think I will call you.
What are you doing?
Trying to keep my shit quick.

Right, you ain't getting none at home.
You got extra energy. Burn it off.
We got anything, Francine?

Sanchez says the air conditioning
contract went to...
...Manuel Arrona of Key Biscayne.

He works out of his house this week.
That's the number.
He's not answering.
I guess we should leave.

Make a trip all the way here
to high society for nothing?

No. That's what they got windows for,
we can peek in.
Yeah, that should be okay.

- I tripped.
- The handle just opened?

- Right after I tripped, it opened.
- They must want us to come in.
Take a peek.
Hello.
We're your new neighbors.

Don't be alarmed.
We're Negroes.

No, man.
Too much bass in your voice.

That scares white folks.
Sound like them.

We were wondering if we can
borrow some brown sugar.

- You fart?
- No, man.
Dead guy.
Looks like somebody's home.
Let me take a stab at this one.

He sells the ventilation plans
to the bad guys.

- He gets rich, but dead.
- You're right on that.

- I'm going to go call Homicide.
- Wait.

Why do you act like this
around corpses?
It's cool. I just--
Please? Look around.

The smell and the--
It's just unexpected, that's all.

It's looks like our buddy Arrona
was a gambler.
Got dog track, jai alai...

- Probably needed money to pay debts.
- Bookie.
Damn, man.

Watch where you swing
the dead leg.
My bad, my bad.

Damn this.
I'm calling Homicide.
I'm a narcotics cop.
Dead bodies...
...dead ends.
Maggots.
What's wrong with you, man?

Hey, want to grab
a couple of burritos?

You drive almost slow enough
to drive Miss Daisy.
Man, the transaction is done.
We ain't got shit, so it's over.

Relax. We got it before,
we'll get it again.
You got it all figured out, don't you?
You got to have faith.

By the time we figured out how,
we'd be out of a job.

Scratch that. Everybody in
the damn unit will be out of a job.
But don't worry.

They tend to think
Mike Lowrey going to be all right.

Especially since they think
you some rich kid playing cop.
Look, man, I ain't got no trust fund.
See, for me, no job, no check.

That's like all the other guys
in the unit.
At least, most of us.
So I'm playing cop now?

This is a game?
I'm just joking?

You always wanting to be
Starsky or Hutch.
You know what?
I'm so sick of this bullshit.

I'm supposed to apologize
for my family leaving me money?
All I ever wanted to be was a cop.

I get up early
and I take it to the max every day.

I'm the first guy through the door
and the last to leave a crime scene.
So fuck you. And fuck them.

And fuck anybody who got
a problem with Mike Lowrey.

- I love you, man.
- Fuck you, Marcus.
I do.
You're cool, man.

- You're my partner.
- Shut up.
Slow-ass driver.

- Driving like a bitch.
- Why I got to be all that?
Slow-ass.

I'll take us off this cliff,
keep fucking with me.

Then it would be, what,
two bitches in the sea?

- Is that what you want?
- Shut up.
My wife know I ain't no bitch.
I'm a bad boy.

Bad boys, bad boys
What you gonna do?

What you gonna do
When they come for you?
Only models and that's all.

Max just dropped by.
I got to go. Bye.

You want me to call around
looking for the newly rich?

Are there any new guys partying a lot,
spending lots of money?

This guy called me
this morning, desperate...

...looking for new girls in town.
Are you available?
It'll be a quick $2000.
I got plans with Julie.

- She's your roommate, right?
- Yeah.

So bring her.
She's cute, she's sexy.

- She's not a working girl, Lois.
- Doesn't matter. He's on speedballs.

He probably so messed up
he can't even get it up.
All right, maybe we'll go check it out.
Could be the party I'm looking for.

A party at the Biltmore.
That'll really rock.
I owe you one.

Forget about it. I'll just deduct it from
the hundreds of favors I owe you.

Am I becoming a guest
who won't leave?
No, I like having you live with me.

I'm an out-of-work photographer
who doesn't know how to cook.
Not a big upside for you there.

What hip individual inspired
this visit to the Biltmore?
It's a favor for Mike Lowrey.

Oh, right. The cop I think you're
a little bit in love with.

Maybe I am.
But we're just friends.

If I were in trouble,
he's the only person I'd call.

I know, I know.
I think I've heard this before.
You must be Max. Welcome.
I'm Eddie.
To the Al Capone suite.
So I guess we're a little early.

- This is my friend Julie.
- Julie.
You like Al Capone, don't you?
I hadn't thought about it much.

I'm not kidding
about this being Capone's.

He had the place
rigged with secret passageways.

- 10 minutes, we're out of here.
- Five.
One drink.

- One sip.
- Hey, what's the whispering about?
Just girl chat.
Where's the bathroom?
Upstairs on your right.
Watch your step.
Come.
Sit.
Enjoy yourself. Relax.

Eddie's got some favors
to play with.
Yes, that he does.

I should've told you sooner
about Eddie's private party.
Well, now it's a surprise party.

Okay, Max, I think we've been here
about 5 minutes too long.
I see you treat yourself well, Eddie.

I needed to blow off
a little steam after...
...the move, you know.

So a little party with
a few friends, that's all.
I was going to invite you guys.
Invite?
Looks like I'm catering this.

I was looking for my 2 keys of dope.
Now I know where they are.
Yours? It's our score.

- And the girl?
- Nobody.
Just entertainment.

- I'm Max.
- Nice to meet you, Max.

I like a woman who
takes pride in her appearance.
Don't you?

I hate when
a bitch lets herself slide.

You look like a model in that dress.
Will you model for me?

Oh, great.
It's the goon squad.

You were a cop.
You should know hookers talk.

You couldn't wait 4 more days
until I made the deal?

- I can't work with that kind of stupidity!
- Stupidity?
I got you connected inside.
I brought you my family.
It's my family now.
We're still friends.

- What're you guys doing?
- You pissed him off.
Jesus, you got blood on me again.
Someone's up there. Upstairs.
Get her. Move!
Get her!
What the fuck?
Shoot her!

- I got her.
- I got her.

- Bullshit, I got her.
- What do you know about shooting?
I can't believe she made it.

- Jesus.
- Are you serious?

- She jumped.
- Fuck.

Find out who she worked for,
and find out where she lives.
It's about fucking time.

Come here, look at this.
See this guy?
He's dead, right?

- Look familiar?
- Eddie Dominguez.

- The ex-cop.
- Two points for you.

And there's some
of our high-grade heroin over there.
That's a headline Sinclair will love.
No sign of forced entry.

What the fuck is all this?
Looks like Beirut.
It's the Al Capone suite.
What can I say? Shit happens.
It's a shitty day.
Real shitty day.

Looks like we've got two shades
of lipstick over here.
Someone's missing from the party.
Listen to me.

Your only function in life now
is to find that person.

It's the only good lead
we got all day.
I'll check all calls to the room.
What you got over there?
Cover her.
He knew the girl?
Look, man.

We'll get the witness
and get the fools who did this.

See if you can
catch a ride with Howard.
Where you going?

Checking calls made to Lois Fields.
Maxie worked for her.

- I'll come with you.
- No, we'll catch up later.
You okay?
I'm cool.
Hello?
Shit.

Look, baby, I know
quality time was my idea.

- Don't talk to me about quality time.
- Hold on, babe.
I need a full file on Eddie Dominguez.
Just a minute.
I got on the red one.

The red one? With the snaps?
Couldn't you wait?
You're never home.
All his files are blocked.

I don't care about his personal files.
He's dead. Unblock it.
Screw you, that's illegal.
No, screw you.

- Are you talking to me?
- No, I'm not talking to--

No, it's a term you use.
"Screw you" is a cop term.
You ain't screwing nothing.
Goddamn it.
Where's Lowrey?
I just paged him.

He's following up
this Lois Fields lead.
The madam?

21-2 Requesting backup.
614 Reach Road.
That might be him.
Yeah, Lowrey's desk.

I need to talk
to Detective Mike Lowrey.

This is Captain Howard.
Can I help you?
You can get me Detective Lowrey.
Is this another paternity case?

No, it's another murder case,
you twerp.

You're not talking about the murder
case at the Biltmore tonight, are you?

I've just seen my best friend
murdered.
I'll only talk to Mike Lowrey.

Why only Mike Lowrey?
I have a detective here--

None of your fucking business.
I talk to Lowrey or I blow town.
Mike, phone. Telephone.

He's coming right now.
Hold on, please.

- Talk to her.
- I ain't got time for these games.
This is the witness from the hotel.

He just got out of the john.
Hold on.

- Talk to her now or she'll walk.
- I can't be Mike.
She's going to walk out.

- This is our witness.
- Calm down.
Hello.
This is Lowrey.

He doesn't talk that way.
Talk like him.

Try to talk sexy.
You don't sound sexy enough.
Captain.
Damn.

You don't know me.
My name's Julie Mott.
I was Max Logan's best friend.
Calm down, calm down.
Talk to me now.

She said if she ever needed
anything...
I need your help.
Give me the address.
All right.

It'll be okay.
Mike's to the rescue.
I'm on the way.

- I'll find Lowrey.
- I can't go.
You got to go.
Get Mike to handle this.

Get to this address now.
Get up.

You won't see your wife for a month!
Get out of the chair!
Get this fucking door fixed.
Mike Lowrey.

No, easy.
Mike Lowrey.
Shit.
Who's there?
Mike Lowrey.
How do I know it's Lowrey?
Because, I'm Mike Lowrey.
We ain't got much time.
Hold your badge up to the peephole.
I won't let you in until you do.
No way.

- What was that for?
- You're not Mike Lowrey.

What do you mean?
You've never met him.

- Max described you differently.
- I'm undercover.

- Prove it.
- I know Max from way back.

- I helped her brother get out of jail.
- So?

From time to time we got together
to bump and grind....
Wrong.
Give me the bat.

Fine.
You don't want to believe me?
You go at this shit alone.
I forgot.

The bad guys probably
know where you live...

...and are coming for your ass.
Good luck.
I saw the whole thing.

I watched him shoot her
like she was nothing.
Please, shut the door.
Look, lady.

You ain't got
no more bats, golf clubs...

...or anything like that
to swing at me, do you?
I knew Max, okay?
I cared about Max also.
I'm just here to help you.
You're not what I expected.

I ain't expect to walk
into Yankee Stadium either.

We got to get out of here, okay?
Let's go.

I've got to get my dogs.
Dukie.
Lukie, Dukie, whatever.
You got a back door?

- Where we going?
- Protective custody.

Fuck that.
I'm only dealing with you.

That was a cop that threw
that party at the Biltmore.

Former cop.
We got rid of him long ago.
Come on, Luke.

Listen, if you want to live,
you got to trust me.
Run! Run! Move!

Here, doggie.
Come on, doggie.
Jesus Christ!
Who the hell was that?
There is too much killing going on!
Go after them!
I'll go around front!
Come on, move your ass. Let's go.
Fuck.
Get in the car.
Damn.

- Go, goddamn it.
- Fucking door.
Go, goddamn it, go.

How did you miss them?
You fat fuck!
Watch your fucking mouth!
Lose weight, you'd have caught them.
I'd like to squeeze your fucking head.
Now you're in fucking trouble.

- You get the license plate?
- I got the plates.
You cockeyed fuck.

This is a getaway car?
We won't get away from anything.

Is this a goddamn
family station wagon?

Oh, my God,
you got a baby seat in the back.
It's an undercover car, okay?

I know they saw my license plate.
Were those the guys who shot Max?

I only saw bullets.
You tell me what they look like.

I don't know. I was busy trying
to keep a bullet out of you.

I need you to look
through some mug shots...
...to identify Max's shooter.

- Where?
- Protective custody.

I told you I'm not going
into protective custody.
I'm not playing.

You really pissing me off.
I'll book your ass.

Oh, yeah? I'll develop amnesia.
I suddenly feel a case of it coming on.
Fine, where would you feel safe?
You want to do protective custody?

We'll do in-home protective custody,
at your place. I can handle that.

Yeah, my place.
My place is--
No way.
Right.
Yeah, my place is the shit.

Mike Lowrey's place.
You right.

That's the best idea you came up
with tonight. Yeah, my place.
Wait here.
Wait here.
Detective Burnett.

How are you? Long time no see.
Mr. Lowrey's not here.
He said I could use his place.
He didn't mention it to me.

Who's the chick?
How's your wife?
Fine, she's fine.

Your kids, they're good?
Family's the most important thing.
Is it?

Mr. Lowrey said you got a baby factory
going on at your house. True?
Here you go.

If that ain't enough,
I'll run you in for extortion.

You know,
I'm so stupid sometimes.
Are you?

Now that you mention it,
Mr. Lowrey mentioned you'd come by.

What did he say?
Did he say he had a key?
Hang out.

- Here.
- Is this it?
You're hurting me.

- Thank you. Good to see you.
- Good to see you.

- Have fun.
- It's not like that.

- Sure, sure.
- It's not like that.
Come on.
Watch your step up through here.

Damn, I must've left
some incense burning.
Welcome to Casa de Lowrey.
This is kind of...
I'm always moving my switches.

I'm always decorating, so sometimes
I just don't know where shit is.
Damn.
Shit.

Why am I tripping on shit
I know is there?
You found a light switch.

I should have known it was there
since I decorated the place.
Mike, this is Yvette.

Ignore this.
It's one of my freaks, Yvette.

She's always calling,
got to have it.

Don't call here no more now, freak.
Just one of my freaks.
All this on a cop's salary?
Well...
...it's honest money.
I'm a second-generation rich kid.

If you're not in it for the paycheck,
are you an action junkie?
If that what you want to call it.

I don't mind bats swung at my head,
bullets grazing my ass.
Gives me a rush.

Look, I'll give you a broad stroke
of the place.

I got some T-bones in the fridge
for Lukie and Dukie...

Sorry, the fridge is this way.
I confuse my own shit.

- Wait, you're leaving me here alone?
- Yeah, I gotta get back to the P.D.

These are Miami's
peak crime hours, you know.
Apparently.

They said this deal was going down
in 4 days, and I, you know...

...obviously seem to be kind of
a major glitch in their--

You ain't with the bad guys now.
You're with the cops.
With Mike Lowrey. You with the cops.

Everything will be all right.
Trust me.
I'll be back.

I know that it's no time to joke,
but remember in the movie when...?
All right, all right.
Thanks for everything, Mike.
I'm going.

- Chet.
- You're one of those in and out guys.
It's not like that, Chet.

- The girl, she's a witness.
- Right.

- Keep an eye out.
- No problem.
Listen to me. Hear me.

- Me?
- That's right.

All right, the moment Lowrey gets in,
you have him call me at home.

- At my home.
- Call you at home.

Use this phone.
Don't let him go upstairs.

But he lives here. I don't wanna argue
with Mr. Lowrey. I could lose my job.

- Chet, trust me on this, okay?
- Okay. Call you from here.
Don't let him up.

- No problem.
- Important witness.
Thank you.

I got an idea. I'm off in 2 hours,
I could go upstairs...
...and watch the door.

Like cops do in the movies.
Sit on the stool.

I got a magazine and everything.
And I don't let anybody in or out.
All kidding aside, I want to help.
